meanings.definition: To find guilty of a crime again.
meanings.sent1: The judge reconvicted the criminal for stealing.
meanings.sent2: The jury reconvicted the suspect after new evidence was presented.
meanings.sent3: The detective jokingly reconvicted the cat for knocking over a vase.
meanings.sent4: Her conscience reconvicted her every time she thought about the crime.
meanings.sent5: The dark shadow of the crime reconvicted him in his nightmares.

meanings.definition: To prove or declare guilty of an offense again.
meanings.sent1: The prosecutor reconvicted the defendant with solid evidence.
meanings.sent2: The court reconvicted the repeat offender for violating parole.
meanings.sent3: The teacher playfully reconvicted the student for talking in class.
meanings.sent4: The weight of his guilt reconvicted him every time he looked in the mirror.
meanings.sent5: The haunting memories reconvicted her of the mistake she made.
